DIV1.HEAD: Die altenglische Legende von St. Brendan Aus Ms. Harl. 2277 bereits von Thom. Wright für die Percy Soc. edirt. aus Ms. Ashmol, 43. fol. 71 b.

HEADNOTE.P: In der durch Ms. Egerton 1993 und Ms. Vernon vertretenen Sektion der Legendenhand∣schriften, welche einen kürzeren und jüngeren Text enthält, fehlt diese Legende, wol wegen ihres mehr romantischen Inhalts.

LG.L: SEyn Brendan, þe holi mon,: was of Irlonde.
Monek he was, of harde lyue,: as ic vnderstonde,
Of vastynge & penaunce Inou;: Monek he was þere V. 3 Ms. Monek st. abbod; so in d. übr. Mss.
Of a þousend monekes,: þt vnder him alle were.
So þt it byuel In aday,: as our lordes wille was,
þt barynt, anoþer abbod,: to him com bi cas.
S. brendan him bisoȝte anon,: þt he scholde him vnderstonde
& telle of þt he hadde iseie: aboute in oþer londe.
þis godemon, þo he hurde þis,: sikynge made Inowe,
& bigan to wepe in grete þoȝte,: & vel adoun iswowe.
Bitwene is armes s. brendan: þis holi mon up nom,
& custe him & cride on him,: vorte is wit aȝen him com.
ffader, he sede, parcharite,: oþer red þu most take:
Huder þu come vor our solas,: & noȝt, such deol to make;
Tel ous wat þu hast iseie,: as þu hast aboute iwend
In þe muchel se of occian,: as our lord þe haþ isend.
Nou is þe se of occean: grettost, & mest also,
Vor heo geþ aboute al þe world,: & al oþer sees goþ þerto.
So þt barynt, þis olde mon,: riȝt at is herte gronde V. 19 Ms. riȝ st. riȝt.
Al wepynge gan him telle: wat he hadde ifounde.
He sede: ichabbe a godsone,: Meruot was is name, V. 21 st. habbe haben die and. Mss. hadde. V. 21 Meruot st. Mernoc.
Monek he was, as we beþ,: & mon of gret fame.
So þt is herte him ȝaf to wende: in apriue stude & stille,
þer he miȝte al one be,: to seruy god to wille.
So þt by myn leue he wende: & al one him drouȝ
To an Ile, ver in þe se,: þt delitable was Inouȝ,
Biside þe mou(n)tayne of stones,: þt couþ is wel wide.
So longe þt þis gode monek: In þis ile gan abide, V. 28 So longe, sc. it was.
þt he hadde of monekes vnder him monyon. V. 29 fehlt: in d. Mitte, wie V. 60, 248, 258, 283, 292, 369, 370, 372, 375, 377, 525, 597, 648, 660.
Anon so ic hurde telle þus,: þuderward ic wende anon.
So þt in a vision: our suete lord him kende,
þt aȝen me, as ic to him com,: þre Iorneys he wende.
So þt we dude ous in ascip,: & estward euene drowe V. 33 die and. Mss. euere st. euene.
In þe se of occian,: wiþ torment(es) Inowe. V. 34 Ms. torment mit Schleifchen an t = es?
Toward þen est so ver we wende,: þt we come atelaste
In astude swiþe derk,: & clouden ous ouercaste.
Al an tide of þe day: we were in derkhede;
Ate laste our suete lord: verrore ous gon lede:
So þt we seie an ilond;: þuderward our scip drouȝ. V. 39 ff. Vgl. mit dieser Schilderung
Briȝt it is as þe sonne,: Joie þer was Inouȝ: V. 40 die and. Mss. wol richtig: Briȝttere hit þoȝte þane.
Of tren & herbes þicke it stod,: biset in ech side,
Of presious stones ek,: þt scynde briȝt & wide;
Ech herbe was vol of floures,: & ech tre vol of frut;
Bote it were in heuene sulf,: nas neuer more dedut.
þer Inne wiþ Joie Inou: wel longe we gonne wende,
þei it lute wule ous þoȝte;: we ne miȝte fynde non ende.
So þt we come to awater,: cler & briȝt Inou,:
þt euene framward þen est: toward þe west drou.
We stode & bihulde aboute,: vor we ne miȝte noȝt ouer wende.
þer com to ous aȝong mon,: swiþe vair & hende;
He wilcomede ous vaire euerichone,: wel mildeliche & suete,
& anempned ech is riȝte name,: & wel vaire ous gon grete,
& sede: ȝe aȝte ihū crist: þonky wel wiþ riȝte,
þt sceweþ of is priuete ȝou: so muche, & of is miȝte;
þis is þt lond þt he wole ȝut: ar þe wordles ende
His dernelynges anerþe ȝyue,: & hider hi scholleþ wende. V. 56 Ms. deruelynges.
þis lond is half in þis side,: as ȝe seþ wel wide,
& biȝonde þe water þe haluendel: as bi þe oþer side; V. 58 þe vor haluendel fehlt in d. and. Mss.
þt water ne mowe ȝe passe noȝt,: þt oþer del to se.
& her ȝe habbeþ alle ȝer meteles ibe, V. 60 & wol zu tilgen. alle ȝer st. al a ȝer, wie in d. and. Mss.
þt ȝe ne ete ne dronke noȝt,: ne slepte noȝt wiþ our eie,
Ne chele ne hete ne fredde ȝe noȝt,: ne no nyȝt ȝe ne seie: V. 62 Harl. fonde ȝe, Bodl. Laud. greued ȝow.
Vor þis (is) godes priue stude,: & þoru him is þis liȝt, V. 63 Nach þis fehlt is im Ms.
þeruore it worþ euer her day,: & neuer nyȝt. V. 64 Nach neuer fehlt more.
Ȝif mon aȝen godes heste: nadde noþing mysdo,
Her Inne he hadde ȝut bileued,: & is ofsprung also.
Ȝe ne mowe her noleng bileue,: aȝen ȝe mote fare;
þei it þenche ȝou lute wule,: ȝe habbe ibe her ȝare.
So þt he broȝte ous in our scip,: & wel uaire is leue nom,
&, þo we were hamward in þe se,: we nuste war he bicom;
Aȝenward he wende aȝen our wille,: it ous of þoȝte sore Inouȝ. V. 71 Ms. our st. ous; ous ist hinter þoȝte zu versetzen.
Aȝen to þis oþer monekes: þis scip we(l) euene drou. V. 72 Ms. we st. wel.
þis monekes ourne aȝen ous,: þo hi myȝte ous ise,
& sori were & wroþ Inou: þt we hadde so longe ibe.
We sede þt we hadde ibe,: wiþ gret Joie & feste,
Byuore þe ȝates of parays,: In þe lond of biheste,
þt our suete lord haþ bihote: hem þt he loueþ her;
þer is day & neuer nyȝt,: & þe leme euer cler. V. 78 Vor day fehlt euer.
Certes, queþe þis monekes,: wel we mowe ise
Bi þe suote smul of ȝou,: þer ȝe habbeþ ibe.
þo s. brendan ihurde þis,: In þoȝte he stod wel stille;
He þoȝte fondi more her of,: ȝif it were godes wille.
He wende among is monekes: & twelf out he nom,
þt he truste mest to of alle,: wen eny neode com.
þis twelfue he clupe in conseil,: & in priuete hem sede: V. 85 Ms. twelf ue. clupe st. clupede.
Ic þenche do apriue þing,: þer of ȝe mote me rede,
To seche þt lond of biheste,: ȝif god wolde ous þuder lede; V. 86 u. 87 fehlen in Harl. u. Bodl.
Seggeþ wat ȝour conseil is,: to do so gret adede!
Leue fader, þe oþer sede,: our wille we habbeþ vorsake,
Our frend, & al our oþer good,: & clanliche to þe itake;
& wen our dede is on þe,: ȝif þu wolt þt it be,
We scholle vawe wiþ þe wende,: our lordes grace to se.
So þt hi uaste fourti dawes,: & gret penau(n)ce dude also, V. 93 Ms. penauce.
& bede ȝerne our lordes grace: þulke viage to do.
Hi let hem make astrong scip,: & aboue it al bicaste
Wiþ bole huden, strong Inouȝ,: & nailede þerto vaste, V. 96 Statt & nailede ist inailed zu lesen.
& seþþe ipiched al aboute,: þt þe water In ne come.
Hi wende to hor breþeren: & wel vaire hor leue nome,
& seþþe in our lordes name: to scipe hi wende anon.
Hor breþeren, þt bihynde were,: sori were echon.
& þo hi were ȝut in þe scip,: after þer come two
& bed hem vaste þt hi moste: þen wei wiþ hem go.
Ȝe mowe wel, s. brendan sede,: ac or oþer schal ate ende V. 103 or = ȝour.
Repenti, ar he come aȝen,: & al quic to helle wende.
Worþ him wende þis holi mon,: wuder our lord him sende; V. 105 Ms. Worþ st. vorþ.
& þis twei monekes, þt come last,: also wiþ hem wende.
In þe grete se of occean: vorþ hi rewe vaste,
& truste al to our lordes grace: & noþing nere agaste.
þe wynd drof hor scip al after wille,: þe wynd was good Inouȝ. V. 109 Statt des ersten wynd haben Harl. u. Bodl. see, wol die richtige Lesart.
As þe wynd hem drof, wel euene: uorþ west hor scip drouȝ, V. 110 Ms. west st. est, vgl. 113.
Euene aȝen þt þe sonne arist: (a)mydsomeres day. V. 111 Vor myd someres fehlt a.
Non nuste of hem war he was,: ne no lond ne say.
Euene est fourti dawes: þe wynd hem drof vaste.
So þt hi seie in þe norþ side: agret Ile ate laste,
Of harde roche, & gret Inouȝ,: aboue þe se wel hei. V. 115 Ms. heie mit wegpunktirtem e.
þre dawes hi wende þer aboute,: ar hi miȝte come þer ney.
A lute hauene hi founde,: a lond hi wende þere. V. 117 Nach founde fehlt þo.
Hi wende aboute as mopismen,: þt nuste war hi were.
þer com gon a wel vair hound,: as it were hem to lere;
At s. brendans vet he vel adoun,: & made hem vaire chere. V. 120 hem st. him.
Beu freres, quaþ s. brendan,: ȝe ne dorre noþing drede:
Ichot þis is amessager,: þen riȝte wei ous to lede.
þis hound ladde þis holi mon: to an halle, vair Inouȝ,
Gret & starc & swiþe noble,: wel euene In he drouȝ.
þe monekes founde in þis halle: bord & cloþ isprad,
& bred & fisc þer up Inouȝ,: þer nas non þt nas glad.
Hi sete adoun & ete vaste,: vor hem luste wel þerto.
Beddes hi seie, ȝare ymad,: ar hor soper were ido;
After soper to bedde hi wende,: to reste hem as þe wise.
þo hi hadde alle islept Inouȝ,; sone hi gonne arise,
& wende aȝen to hor scip,: as hi hadde er ibe.
& In þe se wel longe hi were: ar hi miȝte eny lond ise.
þo seie hi bi þe oþer side: an ile, vair Inouȝ,:
Grene, & wiþ awel vair lese,: þuderwar hor scep drouȝ. V. 134 Ms. þuderwar st. þuderward. scep st. scip.
þo hi come in to þisse vaire londe: & bihulde aboute wide,
þe vairest scip þt miȝte be: hi seie in ech side, V. 136 Ms. scip st. scep.
A scep was grettore þen an oxe,: & wittore ne miȝte be.
Gret Joie hi hadde in hor herte,: þis vaire scep to se.
þo com þer go a wel vair man,: & grete hem wiþ vaire chere,
& sede: ȝe beþ her icome,: as ȝe neuer er nere:
þis is icluped þe lond of scep,: vor scep wel vaire her beþ,
Muchele & wite & grete Inouȝ,: as ȝe al day iseþ;
Vairore hi beþ þen ȝoure scep,: & grettore vn iliche,
Vor muri weder her is Inouȝ,: & lese good & riche;
Her nys neuer wynter non,: ne non hei ifounde, V. 145 hei fehlt in Harl., Bodl. haþ st. hay?; hei = hay, Heu.
Ac hi eteþ þe erbes also nywe: as hi springeþ of þe gronde;
Me ne gadereþ noþing of hor mylc,: þt hi scholde þe worse be; V. 147 Harl. u. Bodl. Ne me ne.
Vor þis þing, & mony oþer,: þe bet hi mowe iþe.
To astude ȝe scholleþ henne wende,: þoru our lordes grace,
þt is foulen parais,: a wel Joyuol place;
þer ȝe sculle þis ester be,: & witsontid also;
Wendeþ vorþ a godes name!: þt þis viage were ido,
S. brendan & is breþeren: to scipe wende anon,
& rewe uorþ in þe se,: in tempest monyon. V. 154 Nach uorþ fehlt wol uaste.
So þt hi seie bi þe one side: an ile, gret Inouȝ.
Hor scip þoru our lordes grace: þuderward euene drouȝ.
þo hi come almest þerto,: up roches it gan ride, V. 157 Harl. u. Bodl. hit cam st. hi come.
þt it ne miȝte to þe ile come,: ac bileuede biside.
þis monekes wode up to þis ile,: ac s. brendan noȝt.
þis monekes gonne make hor mete: of þt hi hadde ibroȝt,
Hi made hem fur, & zode hem fisc: in a caudron vaste. V. 161 Vor fur ist fisc wegpunktirt.
Ar þis visc were isode Inouȝ,: hi were somdel agaste:
Vor, (þo) þis fur was þoruhot,: þe ile quakede anon V. 163 Nach vor fehlt þo im Ms. þoru = þoruout, vgl. V. 473.
& wiþ gret eir hupte al up;: þis monekes dradde echon,
& þe wei toward hor schip: ech after oþer nom,
God leuest, hem þoȝte, he was: þt sonest þuder com. V. 165 u. 166 fehlen in Harl. u. Bodl.
Hi bihulde hou þis ile: in þe se wende vaste,
& as quic þing hupte up & doun,: & þt fur fram him caste. V. 168 steht im Ms. unrichtig hinter 170; die richtige Folge ergibt sich aus Mss. Harl. u. Bodl.
He swam more þen to myle,: þe wule þis fur ilaste.
þis monekes seie þt fur longe,: & were sore agaste;
Hi cride ȝerne on s. brendan: wat þt wounder were.
Beþ stille! quaþ þis holi mon,: uor noȝt ȝe habbeþ fere;
Ȝe weneþ þt it be an ile,: ac ȝe þencheþ amys:
Hit is a visc of þe grete se,: þe meste þt þer is,
Iastony he is icluped;: he fondeþ nyȝt & day
To pulte is tail in is mouþ,: & vor grettnesse he ne may.
Vorþ hi rewe in þe se: euene west wel naste, V. 177 west wol st. est.
þre dawes ar hi seie lond;: hi were somdel agaste.
þo seie hi a wel vair lond,: of floures þicke Inouȝ.
Wel glade hi were, þo hi seie: þt hor scip þuder drouȝ.
In þis vair lond hi wende: lengore þen ic ȝou telle. V. 181 Bodl. wonede st. wende.
So þt hi founde in astude: aswiþe vair welle;
In þe welle stod a tre,: brod & hei Inouȝ; V. 183 Ms. In st. Bi.
ffoules, swiþe wite & vaire,: so þick were in ech bouȝ, V. 184 Ms. þick mit Schleifchen an k.
þt vnneþe eny lef: me myȝte þer on ise,
þt it was Joie & blisse Inouȝ,: to loke on þis tre.
S. brendan vor Joie wep,: & sat adoun akne
& bed our lord to scewe him,: wat such cas myȝte be.
þo fley þer up alutel fowel,: & toward him gan te;
As aviþele is wyngen verde,: þo he bigan to fle:
Mergore enstrement neuer nas,: þen is wyngen were.
He bihuld s. brendan: wiþ wel vaire chere.
Ic hote þe, quaþ. s. brendan,: ȝif þu art messager,
þt þu segge me wat ȝe beþ,: & wat ȝe doþ her.
Ac þei it þoȝte aȝen kunde,: þis fouwel ansuerede anon: V. 195 ac fehlt in Harl.; Bodl.: al þey.
We were, he seide, somtyme was,: angles in heuene echon,
Ac, as sone as we were Imad,: our maister was to prout,
Lucefer, fram is vaire stude: þt he vel sone out,
& wiþ him also monyon,: euer as hor misdede was;
& we velle also adoun,: ac vor non mysdede it nas,
Vor noþing þt we ensented: to is foule vnriȝte, V. 201 Vor vor fehlt wol ne.
Bote soulement vorte scewe: our suete lordes myȝte;
Ne we beþ her In pyne non,: ac In Joie Inou we beþ,
& somdel ney our swete lord,: & is myȝte we seþ;
& bi þe erþe we fleþ aboute,: & bi þe lufte also,
As gode angles, & luþer ek,: riȝt is vorte do: V. 206 ek mit Schleifchen an k.
þe gode, vorte do men good,: þe luþer luþerhede makeþ:
& þe soneday, þt is day of reste,: such fourme we takeþ: V. 208 Vor makeþ ist to wegpunktirt; statt luþerhede liest Harl. liþere, Bodl. leþer.
þe fourme of such wite foweles,: as þu myȝt her ise,
& honoureþ god, þt ous made,: her up þis tre. V. 210 Vor tre fehlt wol brode.
Twelf monþe it is ipassed: þt ȝe gonne verst out wende, V. 211 Ms. ippassed mit wegpunkt. p.
& al þis six ȝer ȝe scholle vare,: ar ȝe bringe þis viage to ende,
Vor, wanne ȝe habbeþ ipassed þis seue ȝer,: our lord ȝou wole sende
An siȝt of þt ȝe habbeþ isoȝt,: ate seue ȝeres ende.
Ech ȝer ȝe scholleþ her wiþ ous: holde ȝoure ester feste,
As ȝe nou doþ, vorte ȝe come: to þe lond of biheste.
Nou was þis an ester day,: þt al þis was ido.
þis fowel nom is leue at hem,: & to is felawes wende also. V. 218 also wol st. þo (Harl.) oder so (Bodl.).
þis foweles, þo it tyme was,: bygonne hor euesong,
Mergore song ne myȝte be,: þei god him sulf were þer among.
þis monekes wende to bedde & slepe,: þo hor soper was ido;
& þo it was tyme of matyns,: hi arise vp þerto.
þis foules songe ek hor matyns: wel riȝt, þo it was tyme,
& of þe sauter sede vers,: & seþþe also prime,
& vndarne seþþe, & mydday,: & afterward seþþe non,
& ech tyde of þe day songe,: as cristenemen scholde don.
þis monekes were in þe londe: eiȝte wuke also,
Vorte al þe feste of ester was,: & of witsonetid, ido.
þo com ate trinyte þis godemon: to hem þar, V. 229: ist hinter trinyte zu versetzen, wie das Versmaass verlangt.
þt spac wiþ hem in þe lond of scep: & ladde hem aboute þar. V. 230 Ms. scip mit überschr. e u. wegpunkt. i. Statt þar ist ar zu lesen.
He chargede hor scip swiþe wel: wiþ mete & drinke Inou,
& nom is leue wel hendeliche: & aȝenward him drou.
þo s. brendan was in þe scip,: & is breþeren al so,
þis fowel, þt spac wiþ him er,: wel sone com him to.
He sede: ȝe habbeþ her wiþ ous: þis heie feste ibe;
Gret trauail ȝou is to come,: ar ȝe efsone lond ise; V. 236 efsone st. eftsone.
Ȝe scholleþ after seue monþes: fynde an vair ile,
þt abbey icluped is,: henne it is mony amyle;
Ȝe scholleþ myd holi men be: þis myd wynter þere;
Ȝour ester ȝe scholleþ holde þer,: as ȝe duden to ȝere: 240 Nach ester fehlt gewiss eue, vgl. V. 362, 388; dann wäre: vor þer zu versetzen.
Vp þe grete visches rugge,: as þin monekes were in fere,
& our ester wiþ ous, riȝt: as ȝe nou were. V. 242 our = ȝour wie V. 61. 103.
S. brendan a godes name,: & is breþeren echon,
In þe se of occean: vorþ hi wende anon.
þe wynd hem harled up & doun: In peril monyon:
So weri hi were of hore lyue,: þt hem ne roȝte wuder gon;
þis four monþes hi wende in þe se: in swiþe gret turment, V. 247 þis wol zu tilgen.
Hi ne sei noþing bote þe se & þe firmament. V. 68-248 fehlen im Ms. Laud., da 2 Blätter ausgerissen sind.
þo seie hi ver fram hem: an ile as it were.
Hi cride ȝerne on ihū crist: þt hi moste ariue þere;
Ȝut, after þt s. brendan: verst þis (ile) isei, V. 251 ile fehlt im Ms. nach þis.
In þe se he wende fourti dawes,: ar he miȝte come þer ney; V. 252 he st. hi.
Hem þoȝte þt hor lif was loþ;: þe monekes were agaste; V. 253 Vor was fehlt hem.
Hi cride ȝerne on ihū crist: & help bede vaste. V. 254 Vor help fehlt his.
A lutel hauene, swiþe streit,: hi founde ate laste,
Vnneþe hor scip com þer Inne;: hor ancre þer hi caste.
þis monekes wende þer alond,: wel longe er hem þoȝte.

Hi wende & bihuld aboute, & þonkede god þt hem þuder broȝte. V. 257 Hier liest Harl. richtig hem þoȝte er, u. V. 258 die letzte Hlbz.: wel murie hem þoȝte þer; die Vorsetzung von er in Ms. Ashm. mag der Grund sein für die Umänderung der 2. Hlbz. in V. 258, die jedenfalls eine Hebung zu viel zählt.
So þt hi seie twei vaire wellen:: þe on was swiþe cler,
& þe oþer wori & þicke Inouȝ.: þis monekes eode ner,
To drynke of þis vaire welle.: s. brendan it isei:
Wiþþoute leue of oþer men: ne come ȝe noȝt þer ney,
Of olde men, þt her Inne beþ,: vor myd gode wille
Hi wolleþ parti þer of myd ȝou,: & þeruore beþ ȝe stille! V. 264 ȝe st. ȝet.
A uair old mon, & swiþe hor,: aȝen hem com gon;
He wilcomede hem vaire Inouȝ,: & s. brendan custe anon;
He nom & ladde him bi þe hond,: al bi a uair wey,
Aboute in mony amuri stude,: & seþþe in to an abbey.
S. brendan bihuld aboute,: & escte wat it were,
& wat manere men were wiþinne,: & ho wonede þere.
Stille was þis olde man: & ne ȝaf him non vnsuere. V. 271 Ms. vnsuere = ansuere.
þo sei he come auair couent,: & acrois biuore hem bere,
Wiþ taperes in eiþer side;: monekes it were echon,
Reuested in uaire copes.: aȝen hem hi come gon, V. 274 Vor copes fehlt wol quer, s. Ms. Laud.
Wiþ procession vaire Inouȝ.: þe abbod bihynde com,
& vaire custe s. brendan,: & bi (þe) hond him nom V. 276 Vor hond fehlt þe, s. V. 267.
& ladde him, & is monekes,: In to anoble halle,
& sette hem adoun a rank,: & wesc hor vet alle:
Of þe wori welle he wesc hor vet,: þt hi er iseie.
In to þe freitore he ladde hem seþþe,: & sette hem þer heie,
I medled wiþ is owe couent;: & þo hi were alle isete,
þer com on & seruede hem,: & vette hem alle mete:
A vair wit lof he sette biuore two & two, V. 283: fehlt nach sette. Statt bi fore lesen die and. Mss. bi twene, wol richtiger.
Wite moren as it were of erbes: he sette biuore hem also;
Swetere þing ne miȝte be,: hi ne knewe it noȝt on.
Of þe clere welle, þt hi seie,: þis monekes dronke echon.
Beþ nou glade, þe abbod sede,: & drynkeþ nou Inouȝ
In charite of þulke welle,: þt ȝe wolden er wiþ wouȝ;
Hit is betere to drinke in charite,: wen it is ȝou ibroȝt, . . .
Vor hoso douteþ ihū crist,: him ne schal faili noȝt.
ffour & twenti freres we beþ here,: & wen we beþ alle isete, V. 289 Hier fehlen 4 Verse, s. u. V. 291 alle fehlt in d. and. Mss.
Twelf suche loues ech day me bringeþ ous to mete; V. 292 Nach day fehlt:.
Ate feste of eche holi day,: & wenne it soneday is,
He bringeþ ous foure & twenti loues,: þt ech monek haþ his, V. 294 he st. me.
& ech frere of þt he leueþ: wite to is soper.
Vor ȝou it is to day idoubled,: as ȝe seþ nou her,
Vor our couent nys noȝt her,: ac haþ muchedel vn ete; V. 297 Vor our fehlt wol al, s. Ms. Laud.
So þt our lord þoru is grace: ech day send ous mete.
Seþþe s. patrikes day,: & s. ailbi also,
We habbeþ ibe her vour score ȝer,: þt nomon com ous to;
Euereft our lordes grace Iued: ous haþ echon. V. 301 Die and. Mss. oure louerd þurf his grace; gewiss ist: vor Iued zu ver∣setzen.
þis weder is euer mury her,: sekenesse nys her non;
& wanne we scholleþ do our seruise,: our lord tend our liȝt,
& our taperes ne beþ noþe lasse,: þei hi berne day & nyȝt.
Hi arise up, & to chirche eode,: þo hi hadde alle iȝete.
Twelf oþer monekes ate quer: hi mette toward þe mete.
Hou is þis? quaþ s. brendan,: wi nere noȝt þes wiþ ous?
Leue fader, þe abbod sede,: it mot neode be þus;
þer nelleþ bote vour & twenti monekes: in our freitor be ido,
&, wen ȝe were þer wiþ ous,: þes ne miȝte noȝt also;
þe wile we singeþ euesong,: þes scholleþ sitte & ete,
Hor euesong hi scholleþ seþþe synge: wen hi habbeþ iȝete.
S. brendan bihuld hor vaire weued;: him þoȝte it was al,
Weued, calis, & cruet,: al pur cristal. V. 314 Statt cruet ist wol cruettes zu lesen.
Seue taperes in þe quer: þer were, & nammo,
& four & twenti seges also,: to wan hi scholde go,
Vor þer were four & twenti monekes,: þt euerich hadde his;
& þe abbodes sege was: amydde þe quer iwis.
S. brendan escte þe abbod þo:: sei me, leue broþer,
Hou holde ȝe so wel silence,: þt non ne spekeþ wiþ oþer?
Our lord it wot, þe abbod sede,: we habbeþ her ibe
Vor score ȝer in suche lyue,: as þu miȝt her ise, V. 322 vor = vour.
Ac þer nas neuereft among ous alle: ispeke anone wise
Ar þis tyme non oþer word,: bote cur lordes seruyce;
Ne we neuereft nere in feblesse,: ne sik of ous noȝt on.
þo s. brendan hurde þis,: uor Ioie he wep anon.
Leue fader, he sede, uor godes loue,: mote we bileue here?
þu wost wel, quaþ þis oþer,: ȝe ne mowe in none manere;
Ne haþ our lord iscewed wel: al þt þu schalt do,
& come ȝut to irlond aȝen,; & þi twelf breþeren also,
& fram þe to þe ile (of) ankres: þe þretteþe schal wende, V. 331 Vor ankres fehlt of im Ms.
& þe fourteþe to helle al quic,: be þer wiþþouten ende?
þo com þer In afury arwe: at an fenestre anon,
As þei he fram heuene come: & þe taperes tende echon,
& aȝenward flei, riȝt as he com,: bi þulke fenestre þere.
þis taperes barnde longe Inouȝ,: & noþe wors nere. V. 336 Statt wors ist wol lasse zu lesen, s. V. 304.
Lord crist, quaþ s. brendan,: ic wondri in my þoȝt,
Hou þis taperes berneþ þus: & ne wonyeþ noȝt.
Nastou noȝt, quaþ (þe) abbod,: in þe olde lawe ifounde V. 339 Vor abbod fehlt þe im Ms.
Hou moyses sei a þorn berne: fram þe croppe to þe gronde,
& þe swiþer þt þis þorn brende,: þe grener þe leues were? V. 341 & fehlt in den and. Mss.
Ne wenestou noȝt þt our lord be: her as miȝti as þere?
þis monekes were to gadere þus,: vorte mydwynter was ido;
Hit was after twelfþe day,: ar hi partede atwo.
Anon to s. hillare day: s. brendan vorþ wende,
Wiþ is monekes, in þe se,: þoru grace þt god hem sende.
Hi rewe up & doun in sorwe Inouȝ,: þe se hem caste heie.
Vorte ver in leynte fram þulke tyme: no lond hi ne seie. 348 fram þulke tyme ist in d. and. Mss. vorangestellt.
So þt aboute palmesoneday: hi bihulde aboute vaste:
Hem þoȝte hi seie ver fram hem: as acloude ate laste.
þis monekes wondred þer of,: wat þe cloude were.
Beþ stille! quaþ s. brendan,: er ȝe habbeþ ibe here. V. 352 here st. þere.
þis is oure gode procuratur,: þt muche good ous haþ ido V. 353 Statt þis ist wol þer zu lesen.
In þe foulen parays,: & in þe lond of schep also.
So þt hor scip ate laste: toward þis ile drouȝ.
A scereþorsday hi come þuder,: wiþ trauail & sorwe Inouȝ.
þis gode procuratur com aȝen hem glad,: & wilcome hem anon, V. 357 gode ist zu tilgen. wilcome st. wilcomede.
& custe s. brendanes vet,: & þe monekes echon,
& seþþe hem sette to þe soper,: vor þe day it wolde so,
& seþþe he wesc hor alre vet,: hor maunde to do;
Hor alre maunde hi hulde þere,: & þere hi gonne bileue
A gode friday allonge day,: vorte an ester eue.
An ester eue hor procuratur: bed hem hor scip take,
& þe holi resurexcion: up þe fisches rug make,
& aftur þe resurexcion: hem het euene te
To þe foulen parays,: as hi hadde er ibe.
þis holi men hem wende uorþ,: & our lordes (grace) nome: V. 367 Nach lordes fehlt grace im Ms.
So þt to þe grete fische: þulke day hi come,

As alond þt houede. hor caudron hi founde ek þere, V. 369 In der ersten Hlbz. fehlt eine Hebung; es ist wol zu lesen: as a lond it were it houede; Laud: þat houede ase it were a lond. Im Ms. ist hinter houede þulke day weg∣punktirt. ek fehlt in d. and. Mss.
As hi bileuede it vp is rugge In þe oþer ȝere.
Louerd crist, þt such abest: houy scholde so stille,
& soffri men þer up gon & do al hor wille!
þis monekes up þis fisches rugge: bileuede al longe nyȝt,
& songe matyns & euesong,: & seþþe, þo it was liȝt,
Anoward is rugge songe: masse echon; V. 375 Vor masse fehlt: und hor; masse st. massen.
& euer was þis muchel best: so stille so eny ston.
As þis resurexcion wiþ gret honur was ido,
& þis monekes hadde isonge: hor massen also,
Aboute vndarne of þe day: to hor schip þen wei hi nome,
& to þe foulen parays: þulke day hi come.
Anon so þe foules iseie hem come,: hi gonne to synge echone 381 Harl. ymone st. echone.
Aȝen hem wiþ gret melodie,: as it were vor þe none.
& þulke þt spac wiþ hem er: aȝen hem sone drouȝ,
þe soun of is wyngen Muri was;: he welcomede hem vaire Inouȝ.
Ȝe auȝte, he sede, our lord crist: honouri myd þe beste:
He purueieþ ȝou vour studes,: to habbe Inne ȝoure reste: V. 386 Vor vour fehlt þis.
Wiþ ȝoure gode procuratur,: ȝoure maunde to do,
& seþþe þe resurexcion: up þe fisches rugge also,
& wiþ ous her þis eiȝte woukes: uorte after witesoneday,
& to mydwynter vorte candelmasse: In þe ile of þe abbay; V. 390 Die and. Mss. fram st. to. þe vor abbay zu tilgen, s. V. 238.
& in þis grete se of occian: in gret peril ȝe scholle wende,
In trauail, al þe oþer tyme,: vorte þe seue ȝeres ende,
& seþþe þt lond of biheste: god wole þt ȝe se
& þer Inne in Joie Inouȝ: vourti dawes be;
& to þe contrei þt ȝe beþ of: seþþe ȝe scholleþ wende,
Al eseliche wiþ (oute) anuy,: & þer ȝour lif ende. V. 396 Im Ms. fehlt oute nach wiþ.
þis holi men bileuede þer: vorte þe trinyte.
Hor procuratur com þo to hem,: þt was euer in pleynte.
He broȝte hem mete & drynke Inouȝ,: as he hadde er ido,
& chargede hor scip þer wiþ,: & let hem wende so.
þis holi men hem wende vorþ,: as god hem wolde sende;
Vor godes grace was wiþ hem,: þe bet hi myȝte wende. V. 402 Ms. hi myȝte hi miȝte, doppelt.
As hi wende vp an tyme: In gret tempest Inouȝ,
A gret fisch hi seie & grisliche,: þt after hor scip drouȝ.
Brenninde fom out at is mouþ: & at is nese he caste; V. 405 Ms. Brennnde.
þt water was herre þen hor schip: biuore hem at eche blaste;
He wolched after as an hous,: & pursiwede hem vaste; V. 406 u. 407 sind umgestellt, s. Ms. Laud.
Wiþ is breste so uaste he scef:: þe monekes were agaste,
& cride ȝerne on s. brendan,: & on ihū crist also.
After þe schip so uaste he scef,: þt he com almest þerto.
As he hem hadde almest of take: & hi ne tolde noȝt of hor lyue,
Anoþer fisc out of þe west: þer com swymme wel blyue,
& encontred þis luþer fisc,: & smot to him vaste,
& uorclef is foule bouk: in þre parties ate laste,
& þen wei as he com er: wel euene aȝen he drou.
þis monekes þonkede ihū crist,: & were Joyuol Inouȝ.
So longe wende þis holi men: in þe se aboute so,
þt hi were of hongred sore;: hor mete was al ido.
þo com þer fle alutel fowel: & broȝte agret bouȝ,
Vol of grapes swiþe rede,: & wel euene to hem drouȝ.
þis grapes he tok s. brendan;: þis gode mon somdel louȝ.
þer by hi lyuede fourtene nyȝt,: & hadde alle mete Inouȝ.
þo þis grapes were ido,: hi were of hongred sore: V. 423 Vor ido fehlt wol alle.
By þe one syde hi seye an yle,: & mete þer Inne more:
þe ile was uol of vaire tren,: & so þicke euerich bouȝ
Of suche grapes as hi hadde er,: þt to gronde it drouȝ.
S. brendan wende upon þis yle,: & of þe grapes nom uaste V. 427 Statt upon þis yle lesen die and. Mss. vp of þis schip.
& bar in to þe schip, to libbe by,: þt fourti dawes ilaste. V. 428 Vor ilaste haben die and. Mss. hi oder it.
Sone þer after þer com a grip fle: vaste in þe se, V. 429 Harl.: vor fleo.
& asailed hem uaste & hor scip,: & fondede hem to sle.
þis monekes cride deluolliche,: & ne tolde noȝt of hor lyue.
þo sei hi come þe lutel foul: toward hem wel blyue,
þt in foulen parays: so ofte hem hadde irad.
þo s. brendan sei him come,: he was somdel glad. V. 434 Die and. Mss. nas noȝt a lute st. was somdel.
þis lutel fowel smot to þis grip,: & nom is dunt wel heie,
þe verste dunt, þt he him ȝaf,: he smot out eiþer eie:
þis luþer best sone he slouȝ,: þt he vel dun in þe se.
þing, þt god wole habbe iwust,: ne schal noþing asle.
þis holi men wende in þe se: aboute her & þere,
& in on of þe four studes: þe vour festes euer hi were. V. 440 euere wol zu tilgen, oder statt þe vour festes ist in reste zu lesen.
A tyme a seyn Petres day,: gret feste myd hor tonge
In þe se hi made of s. petur,: & hor seruyce songe.
Hi come in astude in þe se,: so cler þe se hi founde, V. 443 in þe se st. of þe se.
þt hi sei in ech half: clerliche to þe gronde;
Hem þoȝte þe grond iheled was: wiþ fisc al at an hepe,
þt hi ne seie non oþer grond,: bote as hi were aslepe.
þis monekes bede s. brendan: þt he softe speke,
þt he ne aweite noȝt þt fisc,: leste hi hor scip to breke.
Wat is ȝou? quaþ s. brendan,: war of beþ ȝe adrad?
Vp þe maistres rugge of alle fisches: ȝe habbeþ Imad ȝou glad,
& anoueward is rug fur Imad,; & doþ fram ȝere to ȝere!
þis holi mon þe loddore song,: uor þe none as it were.
þe fisches sturt up uor hor song,: as hi awoke of slepe,
& come al aboute þe schip: al at one hepe,
So þicke hi flote bi ech half,: þt non oþer water me ne sei,
& bi sette þis scip al aboute,: ac hi ne come noȝt þer ney.
So þicke hi were aboute þis schip,: & siwede it euer so,
þe wule þe holi mon is masse song,: uorte it was al ido.
& þo þe masse was al ido,: ech wende in is ende.
Muche wonder me may ise,: hoso wole aboute wende.
þt wynd was strong & stif Inouȝ,: & drof þt schip wel uaste.
As ver as hi wende seuenyȝt,: þe clere se ilaste,
þt hi seie in þe se as clerliche: as hi scholde a londe.
Gret wonder hadde þis gode men: & þonkede godes sonde.
þo com asouþerne wynd,: þt norþward hem drof uaste,
Riȝt euene norþ, hi nuste wuder,: þt eiȝte dawes ilaste. V. 466 norþ st.uorþ? auch Ms. Cotton hat forþ.
þo seie hi, ver in þe norþ,: a lond, derk Inouȝ,
Smokie, as it smythes were.: þuderward hor scip drouȝ.
þo hurde hi of bulies: gret blowynge þere,
& gret betynge, & noyse Inouȝ,: as it þonder were.
þo was s. brendan sore agast,: he blessede him anon (faste). V. 471 Statt, oder nach, anon ist faste zu lesen.
þo com þer out aluþer wiȝt: wel grisliche ate laste,
þoru suart, & brennyng al.: up hem his eien he caste. Nach V. 473 fehlt ein Vers, s. u. 473 þoru, auch Harl., = þoru out.
þis luþer þing made acri,: þt me miȝte ihure wide:
þo come þer suche screwen mo: wel þicke bi eche side,
Wiþ to(n)gen & wiþ homeres,: brenynde monyon. V. 476 Ms. togen st. tongen.
To þe bremme hi ourne of þe se,: toward þe schipe, anon.
þo hi ne miȝte come no ner,: hi gonne ȝolle uaste, V. 478 Vor ȝolle fehlt wol to.
& hor oweles, al brennynde,: after þis men hi caste,
þt me ne miȝte noþing bote fur: ise noþer ihure.
þe se, as it uel adoun,: þoȝte ek afure.
Euerich caste upon oþer: þis oweles al an hei, V. 482 Anders Ms. Laud. s. u.
& aboute þe scip ek in þe se,: ac þer ne com non ney.
Ate laste hi turnde hem aȝen,: þo hi ne spedde noȝt þere;
& al þt lond þoȝte of hem ek: as it afure were,
& al þe se þer aboute: barnde & smokede uaste;
Strong was þe stench & þe smoke,: & wel longe ilaste.
þo þe monekes were so ver,: þt hi ne miȝte ise nammore,
Hor ȝellyng ȝut hi hurde,: þe screwen wope so sore.
Hou þyncþ ȝou, quaþ s. brendan,: was þis a muri pas?
We ne wilneþ come þer nammore,: uor an ende of helle it was,
& þe deuelen hopede wel of ous: habbe iheued a good cas,
Ac, ihered be ihū crist!: hi caste ambes as.
þe souþerne wynd laste ȝut,: & drof hem euer vorþ:
So þt hi seie an hei hul: ver in þt norþ, V. 495 þt wol st. þe.
Cloudi & brennynge smoke,: Muche wo was þere; V. 496 Die and. Mss. gret stench st. muche wo.
þe lye of þe fur stop up an hei,: as it awal were. V. 497 stop st. stod?
Ȝif þer was muche wo in þen oþer,: þer was wel more.
On of is monekes bigon þo: to wepe & ȝelle sore,
Vor is tyme was þo icome,: þt he ne miȝte no leng abide.
He hupte him out amydde þe se: out of þe schip biside, V. 501 Das erste out wol zu tilgen.
& orn him uaste upon þis water: toward þis fure, V. 502 Vor fure fehlt viel∣leicht ilke oder grisliche.
& cride & ȝal deluolliche,: þt deol it was to hure.
Alas, he sede, my wreche lif,: uor nou ic seo myn ende;
Wiþ ȝou ichabbe in Joie ibe,: & Ine may no leng wiþ ȝou wende. V. 505 no leng fehlt in d. and. Mss.
Acorsed be heo þt me bar,: & þe tyme þt ic was ibore,
& þe fader þt me byȝat,: uor nou icham uorlore!
Aȝen him þe deuel com anon,: & nome þen wreche vaste, V. 508 Statt deuel com ist deuelen come zu lesen.
& defoulede him stronge Inouȝ,: & amydde þe fur him caste.
þo vond he þt s. brendan: him sede, þo he out wende, V. 510 him wol zu tilgen u.: nach sede zu versetzen.
Him failede grace, hou so it was,: is lif vorto amende.
So stronge barnde þis montayne,: þt hi noþing ne seie,
þe ȝut hi were ver þer fram,: bote fur & lie.
þo turnde þe wynd in to þe norþ,: & sou(þ)ward hem drof vaste; V. 514 Ms. souward.
In þulke side strong Inouȝ: seuenyȝt þe wynd ilaste.
So longe hi wende euene souþ,: þt hi seie aten ende
An harde roche in þe se,: & þe se þer ouer wende:
þer ouer þe se caste ilome,: & ofte he was al bar.
þo hi come þis roche ney,: of oþer hi were iwar:
Anoueward þe roche hi seie sitte,: wen þe se wiþ drouȝ,
A wrechedde gost, naked & bar,: in meseise Inouȝ:
Aboue him was acloþ iteid: myd twei tongen vaste,
þe neþer ende tilde to is chynne;: ouer al þe wynd it caste,
þt, (wan þt) water him wiþ drouȝ.: þt cloþ, þt heng so heie, V. 524 Nach þt fehlt wan þt; Ms. Cotton.: þt whanne þe.
Bet, as þe wynd it bleu, þen wreche amydde þe eie.
þe wawes bete ek of þe se: bi uore & bihynde; V. 526 Vor bete fehlt him.
Wrecchedore gost þen he was: ne dorte nomon fynde.
S. brendan him bad agodes name: to telle him wat he were,
& wat he hadde god mysdo,: & wat he dude þere. V. 529 Die letzte Hlbz. lautet in d. and. Mss. & whi he sete þere.
Icham, he sede, adeluol gost,: þe wrecche Iudas,
þt uor panewes our lord solde: & anerþe myd him was.
þis nys noȝt my riȝte stude,: ac our lord doþ me grace
To habbe her my parays,: as ȝe seþ, in þisse place,
Vor no godnesse þt ichabbe ido,: bote our lordes milce & ore,
Vor Ine myȝte habbe so muche pyne: þt Inabbe of serued more;
Vor In þe brennynge hul,: þt ech of ȝou isay,
My riȝte is to be & brenne: þerInne nyȝt & day; 537 Statt þer Inne ist wol mit Harl. boþe zu lesen.
þer ic was þis oþer day,: þo ȝoure broþer þuder com
& was in to pyne ilad: & wel sone hadde is dom;
þer uore helle was glad Inouȝ,: þt he made þe grete lie,
Vor Joie þt he was icome,: þt ȝe so ver iseie:
So he deþ wen eny soule: verst is þuder icome;
þoru our lordes heie milse: icham anon þenne Inome, V. 543 anon st. nou verschrieben.
Vor icham her eche soneday,: & fram þe saterdayes eue,
Vorte it be þen soneday eue,: her ic schal bileue,
& at mydwynter ek,: vorte twelfþe day be ido,
& fram bigynnynge ek of ester: vorte witesoneday also,
& our ledi festen ek,: vor vol of milce heo is; V. 546 u. 548 ek mit Schleifchen an k. V. 548 Nach & fehlt at.
& al þe oþer tyme of þe ȝere: in helle icham iwis,
Wiþ pilates & herodes,: anne & cayphas;
Bote ic may corsi þe tyme: þt ic euer ibore was;
Ac ic bidde ȝou vor þe loue of god,: þt ȝe fondi in alle wise,
þt ic bileue her al nyȝt: vorte þe sonne arise,
þt ȝe wite me fram þe deuelen,: þt comeþ sone after me. V. 554 Im Anfang fehlt &.
S. brendan sede: þoru godes grace: we scholleþ wite þe;
Tel me nou wat is þt cloþ,: þt so heie hongeþ þar.
þo ic was anerþe, quaþ Iudas,: & our lordes panes bar,
þis cloþ ic ȝaf an mesel,: uor my nowe it nas noȝt,
Ac it was myd our lordes panewes,: & myd our breþeren, iboȝt;
Ac vor ic it ȝaf vor godes loue,: nou it is me byuore,
Vor me ne schal noþing do uor him,: þt schal be uor lore;
& uor it was of oþer monnes,; as myn Inwit vnderstod,
It doþ me, þei it honge here,: more harm þen good,
Vor it bat In Myn eien sore,: & doþ me harm Inouȝ.
Her me may ise, wuch it is,: to ȝeue of oþer mannes wiþ wouȝ,
As wolleþ mony riche men: myd vnriȝt al day take
Of poure men, her & þer,: & almesse suþþe make;
þt hi doþ uor gydes loue,: ne schal noȝt be vorȝete,
Ac to pyne it schal hem turne,: as hi scholleþ þanne iwite.
þe tongen al so, quaþ Iudas,: þt ȝe seþ honge an hei,
Prestes is ic ȝaf anerþe,: þer uore hi beþ me ney, V. 571 is = as, vertritt des pron. pers. der 3. pers.
Vor clanliche me schal al þing fynde,: þt me deþ uor is loue;
þe ston vp wam ic sitte,: þt makeþ me sitte aboue,
In awei ic fond him ligge,: þer no ned nas to ston,
Ic caste him in a deop dich,: (þt me) þer myȝte ouer gon; V. 575 Vor þer fehlt þat me.
Vewe gode dede ichabbe ido: of wam ic mowe telle,
Ac non so lute, þt I ne fynde: her oþer In helle.
þo it was eue þen soneday,: þe deuelen come blaste,
Vorte lede to helle þis seli gost,: hi cride & ȝolle vaste.
Wend henne, hi sede, þu godes mon!: þu nast noȝt her to done;
Let ous habbe our felawe: & to helle him lede sone!
Vor we ne dorre noȝt oure maister ise,: vorte we him habbe ibroȝt;
Wend fram him, vor hit is tyme,: & ne let þu ous noȝt!
I ne lette ȝou noȝt, quaþ s. brendan,: ne newite ȝou noȝt her,
Ac doþ our lord Ihū crist,: þt is of more power.
Hou darstou, þe deuelen sede,: byuore him nempne is name?
Ne bitraide he him & solde ek: to deþe wiþ gret schame?
S. brendan sede: in is name: ic hote ȝou, as ic may,
þt ȝe touche him noȝt to nyȝt,: ar to morwe day. V. 589 Vor touche fehlt wol ne.
Grisliche þe deuelen ȝolle þo,: & aȝenward gonne fle.
Iudas þonkede pytosliche,: þt deol it was to se.
A morwe, so sone so it was day,: þe deuelen come blaste,
Grisliche hi cride & ȝolle,: & chidde also uaste.
A wei, hi sede, þu godes mon!: acorsed be þe stounde
þt þu come ower her aboute,: & þt we her þe ifounde! V. 595 Die and. Mss.: her owhar, u. we þe her.
Our maister ous haþ itormented: grisliche al longe nyȝt,
& strong Inouȝ, vor we ne broȝte wiþ ous þis luþer wiȝt; V. 597 strong st. stronge. V. 597 fehlt: nach broȝte.
Ac we wolleþ ous wel awreke,: up him sulue it schal go,
Vor we scholle þis six dawes: þeruore doubli is wo.
þis wrechede gost quakede þo,: þt reuþe it is to telle.
þis deuelen nome him grimliche,: & bere him to helle.
Ac s. brendan hem vorbed,: in our lordes name,
þt he nadde uor þulke nyȝt: neuer þe more schame.
S. brendan & is monekes: In þe se vorþ wende
Ȝut þre dawes, euene souþ,: as our lord hem sende.
þe verþe day hi seie an yle: al bi souþe an hei.
S. brendan siȝte sore,: þo he þis yle isei.
Poul, he sede, þe heremyte,: is in þe yle, þt ic ise,
þer he haþ wiþoute mete: fourti ȝer ibe.
þo hi come to þisse yle,: In hi wende echon.
þis hermyte, þt was so old,: aȝen hem com anon;
His her to his fet tilde,: of berd & of heued,
& helede al aboute is bodi,: þer nas bar noȝt bileued,
Non oþer cloþes nadde he on;: is lymes were al hore.
S. brendan him bi huld,: & bigan to sike sore.
Alas, he sede, ichabbe so ȝare: in stude of monek ibe,
& nou In lyue of angel: an mon ic ise.
Be stille! quaþ þis hermite,: god deþ wel bet bi þe,
Vor he scewe þe more þen eny oþer: of is priuete; V. 619 scewe st. sceweþ.
Vor amonek lyueþ bi þe suench: of is owe honde,
& þoru our lordes grace: þu lyuest, & þoru is sonde. V. 621 In Bodl. steht: nach lyuest; ist es hinter þu zu versetzen?
& In þe abbei of s. patric: monek ic was iwis, V. 622 & wol zu tilgen.
& of is chirchei a wardeyn,: þer is purgatorie is. V. 623 Ms. chirchei; merkwürdig ist dass auch in Harl. churchai, in Cotton cerchei steht; es ist doch wol verschrieben st. chirche.
A day þer com amon to me;: ic ecste wat he were;
Icham, he sede, þin abbod,: of me naue þu fere!
Non oþer þen s. Patric: myn abbod is, ic sede.
No ic it am, quaþ þis oþer,: þe ne dar of me noȝt drede;
To morwe aris sone daies,: to þe se þu most wende:
A schip þu schalt fynde ȝare,: as our lord þe wole sende;
Do þe uorþ in þulke schipe: In þe se wel wide,
& it wole lede þe in þe stude; þer þu schalt abide.
Sone amorwe ic aros,: to don is holi bone;
Vorþ ic wende to þe se,: þe schip ic fond wel sone.
Mid me ic let þt schip iworþe,: wel euene uorþ it wende; V. 634 Ms. norþ st. uorþ; vgl. 466.
þen seueþe day to þis ile: our swete lord me sende.
Anon so ic was out of þe schip,: þen wei aȝen it nom,
As euene as it miȝte drawe,: riȝt as it huder com.
Elynge ic eode her al one,; & confort nadde non.
So þt vp is hinder vet: an hotur þer com gon, V. 639 Ms. hotur mit unorgan. h.
Myd is vorþer vet he broȝte: an furire & an ston,
Vorte smyte me fur þer of,: & of fisc good won. V. 641 þer of st. þer wiþ.
þis hotur wende anon awei.: ic made me fur wel uaste, 642 Die and. Mss. aȝen st. anon.
& seþ me fisch a godes name,: þt þre dawes ilaste.
So þt euer þe þridde day: þis hotur to me drouȝ,
& broȝte me mete, þt ichabbe: þre dawes on Inouȝ. V. 645 Die and. Mss. ichadde st. ichabbe.
Water of þis harde ston: þoru our lordes sonde
þer sprong eche soneday,: to drynke & wesche myn honde. V. 647 Nach sprong fehlt out.
þo ichadde þritti ȝer: in þis lyue ibe,
þis welle him gan verst to scewe,: as þu miȝt her ise;
Bi þis welle ichabbe ilyued: fourti ȝer nou & on,
& fifti ȝer ic was old,: þo ic gan huder gon; V. 650 u. 651 im Ms. umge∣stellt. In
So þt of an hondred ȝer: & twenti þerto
Bi þis tyme icham old,: our lordes wille to do, V. 653 steckt wol ein Fehler; ist ȝu lesen: our lord is wille do? Harl. iredi st. old.
& my deþ ic abide her,: wen god hyme (!) me wole sende, V. 654 Ms. hyme st. hine oder him; Harl. hyne, Bodl. u. Laud it; aber Ms. Cotton.: henne.
Wen god wole þt ic to him come: & of þis world wende.
& nym wiþ þe of þis watur,: þt þu hast neode to,
& wend uorþ uaste in þe se,: uor þi wei nys noȝt ido,
Vor þu schalt ȝut in þe se: fourti dawes fare,
& þanne þu schalt þin estur holde,: as þu hast ido ȝare, V. 659 as st. þer.
& þenne þu schalt wende uorþ: to þe lond of biheste,
& þer þu schalt fourti dawes: bi leue ate meste,
& to þin owe lond aȝen: þu schalt wende so.
þis godemen wiþ deol Inouȝ: partede þus atwo. V. 663 þus st. þer, vgl. 723.
þis holi men hem wende uorþ: in þe se wel uaste
ffourti dawes, euene souþ,: þe wule leynte ilaste.
To hor gode procuratur: an ester eue hi come.
Wiþ hem he made Joie Inouȝ,: as he dude er ilome.
He ladde hem to þis grete visch;: þuder hi come an eue.
þis estur nyȝt vorte amorwe: þer hi gonne bileue;
þer hi songe hor matyns: & hor masse also.
þis fisch bigon to meouy him,: þo þe masse was ido,
& bar þis monekes uorþ wiþ him,: & swom uorþ wel uaste
In þe grete se wel grisliche;: þis monekes were agaste.
A wonder þing it was to mete,: hoso it hadde iseie,
A so gret best aboute wende,: as al a contreie. V. 675 as al wol st. al as; al fehlt in d. and. Mss.
To þe foulen parays: þis monekes he ladde echon,
& sette hem vp þer al hol & sound,: & wende aȝen anon.
þo þis monekes þuder come,: wel Joiuol hi were.
Vorte after þe trinyte: hi bileuede þere,
Vor hor creatur þulke tyme: broȝte hem mete Inouȝ,
As he hadde er ofte ido,: & to hor schip it drouȝ; V. 681 creatur, 686 procreatur, ver∣schrieben st. procuratur, procratur.
& wende uorþ myd hem,: as our lord him sende.
Riȝt euene toward þen est: fourti dawes hi wende.
þo þis fourti dawes were ago,: hit gan to hauli vaste; V. 684 ff. vgl. 35 ff.
& wel derk myst þer com also,: þt wel longe ilaste.
Beþ glade, quaþ þis procreatur,: & makeþ gret feste,
Vor ichot we beþ nou ney: þe lond of biheste. V. 687 die and. Mss. ȝe st. we.
þo hi come out of þis derke myst: & myȝte aboute ise, V. 688 ff. vgl. V. 39 ff.
Vnder þe vairest lond hi were: þt miȝte anerþe be;
So cler & so liȝt it was,: þt þer was Joie Inouȝ.
Tren þer were, vol of frut,: wel þicke euerich bouȝ:
þicke it was biset of tren,: & þe tren þicke bere,
þe applen were alle ripe Inouȝ,: riȝt as it heruest were.
ffourti dawes in þis lond: aboute hi gonne wende,
Hi ne miȝte fynde In non half: of þis lond non ende.
Hit was euermore day,: hi ne founde non nyȝt:
Hi ne wende fynde in no stude: so muche clerte ne liȝt.
þe eir was euer in ostat,: nouþer to hot ne to cold. V. 698 to wol zu tilgen.
Bote þe Joie þt hi founde: ne may neuer be itold.
So þt hi come to auair water;: hi nolde noȝt ouer wende,
Ac ouer hi miȝte þt lond ise,: vair wiþþouten ende.
þo com þer gon aȝongliche man,: swiþe vair & hende,
Vairor man ne miȝte be,: as our lord hem gan sende.
He wilcomede hem ech bynome,: & custe hem echon,
& honourede vaire s. brendan: & nom is hond a non.
Lo, he sede, her is þt lond: þt ȝe habbeþ isoȝt wide,
& longe, uor our lord wolde: þt ȝe longe scholde abide, V. 707 Harl. þe lengere st. longe, wol richtige Lesart; vgl. Bodl.
Vor ȝe scholde in þis grete se: is priuetes ise;
Chargeþ ȝoure schip wiþ þis frut,: vor ȝe ne mowe noleng her be!
Vor þu most to þin owe londe: aȝenward anon wende,
Vor þu schalt sone of þis world: þi lif is ney þen ende.
þis water, þt ȝe her iseþ,: deleþ þis lond atwo:
þis half ȝou þencþ vair Inouȝ,: & aȝondhalf it is also;
A ȝondhalf ne mowe ȝe come noȝt,: uor it nys noȝt riȝt.
þt frut is euer iliche ripe,: & þt lond iliche liȝt. V. 715 die and. Mss. þis st. þt.
& wen our lord ech maner men: to him haþ idrawe,
& ech maner men iknoweþ him: & beþ vnder is lawe,
þis lond he wole þenne scewe,: toward þis wordles ende,
Hem þt beþ next icore him,: ar hi henne wende. V. 719 him vor next zu setzen.
S. brendan & is felawes: of þis frut nome vaste,
& of preciouse stones,: & in to hor scipe caste,
& vaire & wel hor leue nome,: þo þis was al ido,
& wiþ wop & deol Inouȝ: partede þus a two,
& wende hamward in þe se,: as our lord hem sende,
& wel sonere come hom: þen hi outward wende.
Hor breþeren, þo hi come hom,: Joyuol were Inouȝ.
þis holi mon, s. brendan,: sone to deþe drouȝ,
Vor neuereft after þulke tyme: of þe world he ne roȝte,
Bote as aman in anoþer world,: & as he were in þoȝte.
He deide in irlonde sone: after þulke stounde.
Mony myracle me haþ: uor him seþþe ifounde. V. 731 Nach haþ fehlt þer.
An abbei þer was seþþe arered: as is bodi was ido.
Nou god ous bringe to þulke Ioie: as is soule wende to.
